org.bk.ass.query

Class UnitFinder<U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<U>
      • org.bk.ass.query.UnitFinder<U>
  • Type Parameters:
    U - The "unit" type, basically anything that has an id and a position
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<U>, java.util.Collection<U>

    public class UnitFinder<U>
extends java.util.AbstractCollection<U>
    Helper class to make area and range queries for "positions". While using an instance all positions and ids *must not* change. That usually means a new instance will have to be created for each frame it is going to be used.
    It should generally be created once at the start of a frame to be used for all queries.
    Example for usages:
    • Initialize with workers only, to find the closest worker for some position.
    • Initialize with enemy attackers to find the closest threat or all threats within a range/area.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static DistanceProvider BW_DISTANCE_APPROXIMATION
      Use this to query using the distance approximation used in OpenBW
      static DistanceProvider EUCLIDEAN_DISTANCE_SQUARED
      When using this, all radius queries need to be made with the squared radius

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.util.Optional<U> closestTo(int x, int y)
      Returns the closest unit to the given position or Optional.empty() if no units are present.
      java.util.Collection<U> inArea(int ax, int ay, int bx, int by)
      Returns a collection of all units in the area with top left (ax, ay) and bottom right (bx, by) including those on the boundary.
      java.util.Collection<U> inRadius(int x, int y, int radius)
      Returns all units with a radius <= the given radius (as determined by the given DistanceProvider).
